articles.title: Canadian inferno: northern heat exceeds worst-case climate models - The Guardian

articles.content:
If you were drawing up a list of possible locations for hell on Earth before this week, the small mountain village of Lytton in Canada would probably not have entered your mind.

articles.title: Boy Scouts of America settles for $850 million with more than 84,000 sexual abuse victims - The Washington Post
articles.description: The settlement is one of the largest of its kind in a child sexual abuse case in U.S. history, but attorneys for victims called it inadequate.
articles.content: The agreement the first legal settlement in a litany of lawsuits against the Boy Scouts is more than double the groups initial proposal to victims in March. The organization is facing roughly 275 abu… [+5728 chars]

articles.title: “In The Heights” does a disservice to Latinx culture - GW Hatchet
articles.description: Miranda’s film leans into uncreative American-centric Latinx generalizations of Brown communities for the entertainment of White ones
articles.content: Last month, Lin Manuel Mirandas long-awaited film In The Heights hit the box office. The film chronicles the challenges of a local bodega owner, Usnavi, who navigates life in an increasingly gentrifi… [+4589 chars]

articles.title: U.S. leaves Bagram Airfield, its military epicentre in Afghan war, after nearly 20 years - CBC.ca
articles.description: After nearly 20 years, the U.S. military left Bagram Airfield, the epicentre of its war to oust the Taliban and hunt down the al-Qaeda perpetrators of the September 11 attacks on America, two U.S. officials said Friday
